entry.title: I’m a Dad boys!
entry.summary:
by SmokEcho

“Hey Tim, are you my son?”

“Yes” Jimmy replied to Grian, clearly distracted with something in a chest as both Grian and Joel stared at him in shock as Jimmy's words caught up to his brain as he spun around clearly embarrassed by what he had just said, but before he could say anything Grian made the punchline of the century.

“I’m a dad now, boys”

OR: Found Family is the best troupe

entry.title: Running Out
entry.summary:
by AstronautBeans

“Hey man! How are the crops getting along?” Impulse asked, leaning against the wall to watch him work.

He sighed, standing up and hearing his back pop when he stretched. His comm buzzed with an incoming message. As he unhooked it from his belt, he shrugged. “Slow. It’s always slow at the start- wait, what?”

His screen lit up brightly in the dim base. There were no new messages, but the screen fuzzed and glitched every so often. When he tapped on it, nothing opened.

As he looked to the top of his screen, his heart nearly stopped. His timer, the one connected to his life, was counting down faster than his eyes could track.

Or, Etho’s timer runs out prematurely

entry.title: These Small Hours
entry.summary:
by Pixiemage

Jimmy sighed softly, adjusting his wings to take some pressure off an aching point near his spine.

He missed Tango, was the truth of it. He knew his soulmate was on the same server as him, not even that far away with how small the map felt this season, but it still felt too far. Especially after the lone, brief exchange they’d had earlier in the rush of the game–

 

Teasing and bickering across a small stretch of water, Joel killing the cow, Etho spinning the boat around to face him, Tango leaping across the water to get a better view. Then Jimmy had rushed forward, had elbowed Tango aside, had only realized his mistake when he caught Tango’s stumbled, half-wincing landing out of the corner of his eye. He had cast a sheepish smile back over his shoulder, tossed back an apology - “Sorry, rancher!” - and their eyes, however briefly, had met. Tango had grinned, had laughed, had looked almost proud, and then threatened his life with a smile and wink. Then Jimmy and Joel had fled, and Etho had watched them go, and then…

 

Jimmy withheld another sigh and sat up, rolling his shoulders and his head to dispel the crick in his neck. There was no way he could sleep like this.

entry.title: Triad
entry.summary:
by astronomeridian

“You’re not going to hump me, Tim,” Grian snaps, smiling wide and toothy, and does a sort of leg-swing thing that ends with him on top of Jimmy, one knee pressed to Joel’s where he’s lying awkwardly beside them with his left arm pinned under Jimmy. “What do you want to do.”

“Next time,” Jimmy says, still trying to wriggle. “We can—there’s time, Grian, please, this time can we just—”

“Gagging for it,” Joel murmurs, not quite sure he meant to say it out loud, but Grian beams at him so it must be right.

entry.title: love me, love me, you want to leave
entry.summary:
by n1ghtm0th

The Watcher ignored him. He needed more. Something older. Something that branded them, sealed their fate, cursed them. His hands spun through the air again, mechanical bug-limb movements.

A thread came loose. He plucked it, turning it over in his hand. "Here?"

"Don’t– Please–"

This time, Scar did fall. His knees hit rough grain, palms sinking into sand.

The Watcher is alone, alone, alone. But somewhere in the great empty void, a voice calls a familiar name, and he has no choice but to listen.

Or, Watcher!Grian meets life series!Scar.
